snippet: Governor Rick Scott’s task force on higher education suggested that tuition rates be frozen, so that going to school for science would cost less than getting a liberal arts degree.
abstract: Florida Gov Rick Scott's task force on higher education, looking for ways to steer students toward job-friendly degrees, suggests that Florida's 12 state universities freeze their tuition rates for three years for majors that are in high demand in job market, including those in science, engineering and health care.
lead_paragraph: Governor Rick Scott’s task force on higher education suggested that tuition rates be frozen, so that going to school for science would cost less than getting a liberal arts degree.

headline.seo: Florida May Reduce Tuition for Select Majors
headline.main: Florida May Reduce Tuition for Select Majors
headline.print_headline: To Steer Students Toward Jobs, Florida May Cut Tuition for Select Majors
